== Main Inclusion Report for virtkey ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/v/virtkey, available for all supported architectures
# ''Rationale:''
** Library component required by onBoard
** Seveloped as a SoC project specifically for Ubuntu
 0. ''Security:''
** No <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=virtkey|CVE entries]]</nowiki>.
** No <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=virtkey|Secunia history]]</nowiki>.
** No binaries running as root or suid/sgid.
** Does not open any port.
** Sends characters directly to X (not sure if this has security implications, so I mention it here).
** Source code review: 
 0. ''Quality assurance:''
** Package works out of the box without configuration.
** Package does not ask any debconf questions.
** Actively maintained by author (he has prepared the Ubuntu packages with guidance from motus and dhobach).
** Does not deal with exotic hardware which we cannot support.
 0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** Meets the <nowiki>[[http://www.debian.org/doc/packaging-manuals/python-policy/|Debian Python Policy]]</nowiki>
** Meets <nowiki>[[http://www.netfort.gr.jp/~dancer/column/libpkg-guide/libpkg-guide.html|Debian library packaging guide]]</nowiki> standards.
** Standard debhelper/cdbs/dbs packaging, standard patch system.
** 'Upstream' maintained in <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/products/onboard|LP bzr branch]]</nowiki>.
 0. ''Dependencies:''
** All in main.
